ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 356
ygData.msgSnippet: Try being a necro tinkerer, that is hated in all of about four places in the world and traveling without the comfort of a teleport all the time. You would
ygData.messageBody:
Try being a necro tinkerer, that is hated in all of about four places in the
world and traveling without the comfort of a teleport all the time. You
would think that they would have at least put all the previous tinker pieces
in velious. as it is, you have to run back and forth between either akanon
and there, or Overthere and Velious.... very poor planning indeed. If they
thought it would be fun to make you run all over the world for components,
they were dead wrong, and I think the person that thought that one up needs
to be put into a tinkered Iron Maiden for a while.

Talisson BoneDancer


-----Original Message-----
From: EQ_Tinkering@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EQ_Tinkering@yahoogroups.com]
Sent: Saturday, February 10, 2001 1:54 AM
To: EQ_Tinkering@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 356



There are 4 messages in this issue.

Topics in this digest:

1. Re: Digest Number 354
From: Conrad Lesnewski <clesnew@...>
2. Re: Digest Number 354
From: Tom Magrino <lord_wire@...>
3. RE: Digest Number 354
From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
4. RE: Digest Number 354
From: James Walker <kc7sbp@...>

Message: 1
Date: Fri, 09 Feb 2001 08:53:52 -0500
From: Conrad Lesnewski <clesnew@...>
Subject: Re: Digest Number 354

Actually, That's a minus. It's not that you can have it equipped, in fact,
you MUST have it equipped. It won't fire from an inventory slot :( I
prefer being able to move the telescope out of a bag and firing it from the
inventory for as long as I need it, as opposed to having to give up my
Incandescent Mask whenever I want to use an Eyepatch. btw, The level
restriction on the eyepatch is 10.

Calbasil Psyrex of Ak'Anon (Terris-Thule)



At 05:58 AM 2/8/01 , you wrote:
> > >
> > >Eyepatches are a joke. Use spyglasses.
> > >
>
>There is one advance on the eyepatch, and that is that
>you can have it equipped and put it on a hotbutton.
>Makes using it easier. Most people can't afford the
>luxury to have a main inventory slot set up like this
>with the telescope.
>
>Still, the level restriction is a big joke.
>
>Piip Ignatz
>Innoruuk
>

Message: 2
Date: Fri, 9 Feb 2001 14:28:12 -0800 (PST)
From: Tom Magrino <lord_wire@...>
Subject: Re: Digest Number 354

Lol! Being a Gnome Wizard who tinkers in this game
just keeps getting worse and worse. You would think
that by now they would at least have put more than a
few tinkering items in the game that are actually
useful. *sigh*

Hexer Winzig
55 wizard
129 tinkerer

Message: 3
Date: Fri, 9 Feb 2001 15:37:17 -0700
From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
Subject: RE: Digest Number 354

Yeah like a lvl 12-16 pet would be unbalancing. You can already get all the
lvl 12 fire pets you want from Upper Guk, why would having one that was
tinkered with charges be a problem?

Message: 4
Date: Fri, 9 Feb 2001 15:39:37 -0800 (PST)
From: James Walker <kc7sbp@...>
Subject: RE: Digest Number 354

No kidding! How about something that anyone could use
and would actually buy! Maybe a tinkered corpse
locator or a clockwork sword with ranged attack spell
charges or something. I do like the pet idea I've been
wondering when we'd be able to build clockwork spiders
or rats or heaven forbid a clockwork gnome.
